data.title: Lucille Ball
data.meta_description: Lucille "Lucy" Désirée Ball (b. August 6, 1911 – d. April 26, 1989) was an American actress, comedian, model, entertainment studio executive, and producer. She was the star of the self-produced sitcoms I Love Lucy, The Lucy Show, Here's Lucy, and Life with Lucy, as well as comedy television...
data.text:
Lucille "Lucy" Désirée Ball (b. August 6, 1911 – d. April 26, 1989) was an American actress, comedian, model, entertainment studio executive, and producer.

Biography[]

She was the star of the self-produced sitcoms I Love Lucy, The Lucy Show, Here's Lucy, and Life with Lucy, as well as comedy television specials aired under the title The Lucy-Desi Comedy Hour. For twenty years, Ball was married to Desi Arnaz, who played Ricky Ricardo on I Love Lucy. However, by 1960, they divorced. Despite the divorce, Lucy and Desi remained friends until Arnaz's death in 1986. Ball then married Gary Morton in 1961.

Death[]

On April 26, 1989, Ball died after losing consciousness from an aortic dissection at the age of 77. She was predeceased by her first husband, Desi Arnaz. She is survived by her two children, Desi Arnaz Jr. and Lucie and her brother, Fred, who died in 2007. Gary Morton, her second husband, died in 1999, ten years after Ball's death.

Shows appeared[]
